event.name: DYNASTY_ROCK_HERESY
event.text: There is a Crusader vessel here. "Pah! We came to this sector searching for truth by questioning the spirits who traverse these regions, in an effort to bolster the word of Chrysolisism. Yet all I have found here is heresy. I do not know how these heretical lies infiltrated the words of those long passed, but our mission has stopped dead in its tracks."

choice.text: Encourage them to look for the truth, not ask for it.

event.text: You tell the Crusaders that the Dynasty is a well-established culture with goals of their own - they can learn more by how they say things and what they believe than by just expecting to be told what they want. "Hmph, I did not expect wisdom from a Renegade. Very well, we will look back on what we've been told and search between the lies." The Rocks send you their flight records as appreciation for the pep talk.

choice.text: Inform them of their fallacious reasoning.

event.text: You tell them that they are starting with a conclusion that they want to find - and that this is called "Motivated reasoning". They react about as poorly as you might expect.
You avoid rocking the boat - no need to aggravate them.

event.name: DYNASTY_CACHE
event.text: You've heard the Dynasty has various caches strewn about since ancient times. Looks like one has been abandoned here. Maybe you can open it?

Your crew successfully smashes open the cache. Inside looks to be some ancient, decayed weapon. It's nothing fancy either, just an older model of any modern weapon. Still, it's a weapon, and its accompanied by some scrap too!

You blast open the cache with your weapons. Inside looks to be some ancient, decayed weapon. It's nothing fancy either, just an older model of any modern weapon. Still, it's a weapon, and its accompanied by some scrap too!
Better not to risk touching Dynasty property in Dynasty space.
No matter how much you try, you simply can't open the cache. Whatever is inside shall remain forever a mystery. Or at least until someone with stronger firepower comes by.
No matter how much you try, you simply can't open the cache. Even worse, you've been spotted by a Dynasty ship, which moves in to attack!

You manage to pry open the cache. Inside looks to be some ancient, decayed weapon. It's nothing fancy either, just an older model of any modern weapon. Still, it's a weapon, and its accompanied by some scrap too!

event.name: DYNASTY_SLUGOCC
event.text: Usually, Dynasty ships aren't so open to soliciting to ships like yours, but one here seems in need of your assistance. "Thou are of the Federation? A military vessel no less? You will be perfect. I am the leader of salvage operation DN-43, and my task was to reclaim Dynasty property left on this planet. I have been met with a most... unfortuitous happenstance. This planet is now occupied by... egh... Slugs. I am a salvager, not a soldier. Might you assist?"
You move closer to the planet, where you can see the Slugs have already built several basic settlements.
You raise your weapons and attack one of the Slug vessels in the colony.
You didn't come here to do other people's work. You have much more important matters at hand.

event.name: DYNASTY_DUEL
event.text: Clearly, the Rebels did something to the Dynasty to anger them so. A Rebel and Dynasty ship are squarring off... but they haven't seen you yet!
You prepare to fight the Dynasty ship.
You prepare to fight the Rebel ship.
Neither ship is your ally, and you doubt helping either is in your best interest.

event.name: GHOST_DUEL_REBEL_SAVE
event.text: The Dynasty ship is dead, leaving just you and the Rebel behind. They reluctantly thank you, and agree to give the fleet false information on your location.

event.name: GHOST_DUEL_GHOST_SAVE
event.text: The Rebel ship is dead, leaving just you and the Dynasty ship behind. A line of static is sent over to your ship, which you assume means thank you. Your suspicions are confirmed when the Ghost beams over an able soldier to assist you!

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_FILTH
event.text: The Dynasty has employed several fleets of ships strictly for salvaging ruins. You see no ruin here - but nonetheless a salvager vessel is darting back and forth.
"The FILTH! The FILTH! Oh how it lingers, its foul scent clings to my form and I feel the FILTH crawling under my plasma membrane! The shivers, oh the horrors! However shall the filth be cleaned?!?"
"DO NOT- do... do not tell me to 'calm down'. Lest you spare me the details and inform as to how you find necessity in my botherings? Do you seek to help?"

"Do thou suffer from a fatal case of ear cloggage? The FILTH, you dimwitted poppy sniffing breather! The rubbish left behind by fellow breathers like the dastardly Rebels! Oh, I do believe you call it 'scrap'. Collect for us a substantial amount so that I may declare this beacon clean and I shall reward you... erm... my sincerest gratitudes?"

choice.text: Take some time to collect some scrap for him.

event.text: The fleet will probably catch up a bit while you do this, but you gather a large collection of scrap and show it to the Ghost. "No, NO! MORE! MORE! The FILTH still persists to ruin my day and clutter the system!"

The fleet has no doubt moved even closer during the process, but you bring back an even larger haul than before. "Gah, you are mentally impaired! No no no! MORE! You oaf! Do not stop until the stars twinkle yet again in the starry abyss of the sky!"

choice.text: Gather even more scrap for him.

event.text: There's no doubt the Rebels are really on your heels now. "Good! At the final hour of the rotational cycle you have met my demands most valiantly! You bring me sense of triumph! The FILTH is no more! A heroic warrior against the plague of the FILTH deserves none other than me by their side!"

choice.text: This guy is a nutjob. Put him out of his misery.

event.text: "Oh, oh! Oh how they warned me of this day! You musn't linger, Orbitious, you musn't linger! Now the men of villainous pursuits come to strike you! Fear the reaper, devil men!"
The strange behavior of this ship is too suspicious for your liking.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_SPLIT
event.text: Looks like several Dynasty ships have docked around a medical outpost, including several elite Reaper vessels. What could be going on there?

Before you can even step aboard, a Ghost Alpha comes running but stops when they see you. Behind them follows a medical staff. "Outsiders? Unforetold, but fortuitous. Our friend here has exceeded splitting capacity, but has yet to divide out of fear. Could you provide some remedy for their caution?" You notice the Alpha is trembling, staring at you with its featureless face.

choice.text: Try to talk the Alpha into splitting.
Shelter the Alpha from the other Ghosts.

event.text: You quickly motion for the Alpha to follow, and they do so willingly. Running back to your ship, it looks like you've angered the Dynasty ships. One of their Reaper vessels is dispatched to reclaim their soldier.

Under the influence of the mind control, the Ghost Alpha is subdued long enough for the Dynasty medical staff to inject them full of a blue liquid that apparently begins the splitting process involuntarily. They thank you for your efficient problem solving and offer a reward.

choice.text: (Upg. Mind Control) Force the Alpha to split.

event.text: The Alpha begins to shake more violently, and suddenly erupts into a fine mist, slowly reforming into two separate Ghosts. The twins look at each other and begin to scream, but are subdued by the confused medical staff. "What in the great nebula has occurred? This is not how the process is intended to go about! I-I truly am uncertain of what to consider of this situation. These ones are not... uh... we would rather not have them in the field of battle. Have them instead."

You catch various odd phrases among the Shell's speech like "plasma membrane" and "rapid sub-division of the quantum something something". Does it mean anything? You're inclined to say no. Later, your Shell does indeed tell you that they made up everything they said, but it seems to register with the Alpha who finally agrees to go through with the process. The medical team pays you for your help.
Voluntarily putting yourself closer to the firing range of an elite Dynasty vessel doesn't sound like the best idea right now.
No matter how much you try, the Alpha simply won't listen to you. You give up and apologize, explaining you don't have any other way to help.
You have no idea what you're talking about, but you try to sound as calming as possible. Your second opinion seems to coax the Alpha into submission. The staff of the station offer a paltry reward.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_TRINKETS
event.text: "The demons linger about... come aboard, it's safe from them here. I have many wonders aboard, maybe you'd like one?" A softly speaking Ghost waves for you to come aboard.
You step aboard the ship, surprised to find it's full of oxygen. Around the walls are hanging various small trinkets. "These are my prized creations. Would you care for one? Only 10 scrap..."

choice.text: Buy a totem of war [+8% weapon fire rate].
Buy an emblem of speed [+20% crew movement speed, +20% FTL recharge rate].
Buy an ingot of fortitude [+20% shield charge speed, +10% system sabotage resistance].

event.text: You have better things to do than looking at 'wonders' right now.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_TRINKETS_WAR
event.text: "Heheh... just don't ask how it works." You head back to the ship, uncertain what to do with the object. You finally decide to place it on your dashboard and hope it works.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_TRINKETS_SPEED
event.text: "Heheh... just don't ask how it works." You head back to the ship, uncertain what to do with the object. You finally decide to place it on your dashboard and hope it works.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_TRINKETS_SHIELD
event.text: "Heheh... just don't ask how it works." You head back to the ship, uncertain what to do with the object. You finally decide to place it on your dashboard and hope it works.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_INTERROGATION
event.text: Looks like something important is going on nearby. You pull closer and see a group of Dynasty vessels parked around a disabled Auto-ship, shouting at it with their weapons charged.
"We have captured the demon! Hark, yet it speaks not. Speak foul beast, speak! By the command of the Prime Reaper, we demand ye speak!"
The Ghost's 'head' swivels to face you. "Huh? What garble do you speak?"

choice.text: It's not alive. It's just a machine.
(Engineer Crew) Interface with the Auto and "make it speak".

event.text: Your engineer remotely access the Auto-ship and powers it online. Fortunately, its vocal module is still active. "OooOooOoOoh! You have captured me. You are now cursed! If you do not give the Federation all of your scrap, your children will be stillborn and your crops will be plagued. OooOoOoOoooOh!" The Ghosts suddenly go into panic, scrambling for a weapon, until they realize you're a Federation ship. Desperate not to be cursed, they give you all of their scrap.

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Interface with the Auto and "make it speak".

event.text: You stealthily deploy your hacking module onto the Auto-ship and power it up. Fortunately, its vocal module is still active. "OooOooOoOoh! You have captured me. You are now cursed! If you do not give the Federation all of your scrap, your children will be stillborn and your crops will be plagued. OooOoOoOoooOh!" The Ghosts suddenly go into panic, scrambling for a weapon, until they realize you're a Federation ship. Desperate not to be cursed, they give you all of their scrap.
These Ghosts don't seem to realize the Auto-ships can't speak. At least, not unless programmed to. Sentient Auto-ships? That's silly...
This looks pretty serious, and it's probably safest not to interlude.
The Phantom merely laughs you off. "This is why we do not seek the help of the Federation for matters such as this."
Before the Ghosts can respond, suddenly the Auto-ship powers on. Looks like the Ghosts didn't do a good job of disabling it... and you'll have to help them or run!

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID
event.text: You weren't really prepared to encounter a Slug Hacker vessel out here, but it looks like they're having some sort of auction with a few pirates and even a Reaper vessel!

The Hacker pauses his counting to introduce you. "Why, I have invented a pieccce of tech unlike any you've ssseen. Capable of fully disssabling autopilotsss running only off of nonessssential backup power, or ssshut it off entirely for only 2 reactor barsss! These Dynasssty folkssss ssseem to really want it. If you're gonna bid, you'll have to enter at leasssst, oh, 30 ssscrap."
"Then let the bidding begin!"
The Slug begins to call off numbers, and eventually the Dynasty raises the price. Current Price: 30 scrap.
Still pretty low. The Phantoms raise almost immediately. Current Price: 35 scrap.
The sounds of numbers being rapidly listed off quickly fades as you distance yourself from the auction.

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_40_BID
event.text: No way you're walking away with it still that low. An Engine Jammer does practically the same thing but worse for 45 scrap. The Dynasty raises again. Current Price: 40 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_45_BID
event.text: You're now matching the price of an Engine Jammer. This is more valuable for sure, but it's quite a lot of scrap nevertheless... Current Price: 45 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_50_BID
event.text: The Dynasty ship falters, but raises once again. Current Price: 50 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_55_BID
event.text: The Ghosts are starting to get frustrated, but they won't relent. Current Price: 55 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_60_BID
event.text: This time the Dynasty ship doesn't even have a chance before one of the pirates in the background raises instead. Looks like the bidding will keep going. Current Price: 60 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_65
event.text: At last, the Ghosts give up, and none of the other pirates bother to move. Looks like you've won! The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_SMUGGLER
event.text: A black smuggler ship comes drifting out of the nebula a few minutes after you jump in. "Good, just who we've been hoping to see. A ship with guns better than ours! I'd be surprised if you haven't caught wind of these Ghosts yet. Dynasty, more like DyNASTY! Am I right? Right? Yeah ok. Anyways, we're carrying a shipment full of 'unethically obtained' armaments or however you fancy people say it. Dynasty won't cooperate and just let us through. There's a security checkpoint nearby. Take it out or 'convince' them to let us pass and we've got a spicy new weapon for you. Deal?"

You approach the station, and are surprised to find they hail you first! "Be on the watch, trouble is stirring in the nebulas. A pirate with dangerous cargo has been spotted, but their location remains unknown. If you have any information on their whereabouts, do not hesitate to share it."
The most reliable way to help the smugglers is simply to blow these Ghosts up. Hopefully should be easy enough.
"For what is this generous donation? Hark? To turn a back to the security of this beacon for the next 5 hours? Well, I do suppose this is a deal we can arrange."
You hail the smugglers, letting them know it's safe. "A bribe? How boring, I was looking for some damn fireworks! But, I'm a man of my word. Sometimes. Right now I am. But not always. Here you go."

choice.text: Sell them the location of the smugglers.

event.text: You doubt the Smugglers are going to give you a weapon after this, but it was effortless scrap, and who can complain about that?

choice.text: (Savior of the Dynasty) Could you do us a favor?

event.text: "Oh the gods bestow upon me an honor like I never knew! An embarassment, I am, for not having recognized the savior of our lands! Yes, yes, we will do anything!" You kindly ask them to allow your smuggler 'friends' through, and they oblige without hesitation.
You hail the smugglers, letting them know it's safe. "Hah, what was that? I was looking for some damn fireworks! But, I'm a man of my word. Sometimes. Right now I am. But not always. Here you go."
You don't make deals with pirates, but you'll gladly fight them instead!

choice.text: We aren't going to work for some smugglers.

event.text: You somewhat rudely decline the smugglers' offer and fly away.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_AUTOQUEST
event.text: Almost immediately, you receive a hail from what appears to be an Auto-station lingering nearby. "Hello. This is a prerecorded message for all nearby non-Dynasty vessels. The nearby settlement of Ghosts has proven problematic for the Rebellion. Recapture it, and this platform is authorized to reward you with a drone."

It feels weird working for the Rebellion, but you can't think of anything more satisfyingly ironic than using their own weapon against them. Assuming you succeed, of course. As you approach the colony, one of their vessels rises to face you.
It means you won't get the weapon, but it's much easier just to kill this Auto-station than to go fight a Dynasty colony. Plus, it means not working for the Rebellion!

choice.text: Let them sort out the problem on their own.

event.text: Neither the Rebels' nor the Dynasty's problems matter to you.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_ZOLTAUTO
event.text: You notice the shadow of a ship slipping through the nebulas behind you, and begin to fear it might be following you, until it comes bursting out of the clouds, revealing itself to be a Dynasty vessel. Their weapons are off however, and their comms are open for communication.

"We have identified you as a Multiverse Renegade vessel. Does this statement hold true? If so, we suspect you are not opposed to matters of mercenary work. A ship of automated nature but Zoltan origins has been spotted dangerously close to a loyal Dynasty colony. While these do not pose the same threat as a Rebel vessel, it could create hysteria of immense proportions amongst our citizens. Could you disable it?"
"Then you are of no use to us. Furthermore, you are trespassing on Dynasty territory, and must be removed."

"Federation vessel registered entering combat proximity. Forwarding data collection to Ministry." Guess your crime won't go unnoticed by the Zoltans, but they're too far away right now to do anything about it. First, you have to take out this Auto.
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."

"I most often discard the mercenaries I first hire to do dirty work, but I admire your willingness to cooperate. Though my superiors would cry to the heavens at this sin, I shall slide you a parcel of scrap in exchange for your efforts."

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_DESERTERS
event.text: From the depths of the clouds approaches a Dynasty ship, their captain speaking in a soft whisper of static. "Please aid us... we are no longer of the mind to take part in the Reaper's war. I desire an outing. May I desert to your ship?" Before you can even consider responding, you notice a quick blur of motion in the distance. Looks like the deserters are being followed.

choice.text: Allow the Ghost onto the crew.
Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.

event.text: You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the rogue Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
Looks like the deserters have already given up. They hardly even protest as they are handed over to the other ship. The loyal Dynasty ship thanks you, and offers a reward.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the chasing Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
You quickly usher the Ghost crew aboard, and by some miracle it appears you weren't spotted. You quickly fly away with your new crew aboard.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_LOST
event.text:
You notice an unusual amount of static over your radio. You play with it a bit until suddenly your translator switches on and begins to spit out dialogue from a Dynasty ship concealed nearby. "We are but hopelessly disoriented, you brainless bobolyne!"
"Oh close thine mouth, you worthless bespawler. We have no brains, we are but gas! This senseless debauchery of the insults will present us no solution."

"Oh, Reaper's sweet travesty, you are Federation! We shall take no 'help' from you, fiend!" This wasn't the reaction you expected, but if you can force them into surrendering perhaps they'll finally be willing to take your help?
"Oh, but speak not further! For it seems a fellow is offering us their most charitable aid. Many thanks, good friend. We shan't let this favor go forgotten."
It's better to let the Ghosts bicker between themselves than to let a Dynasty ship harass you.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_OCCUPIED
event.text: While it can be hard to tell the differences between nebulas, something is definitely off here. Several bright lights through the clouds guide you to a massive Dynasty mining colony, built in loosely-joined structures around a fleet of ancient and dilapidated ships. You expect to see heavy traffic, or at least signs of activity, but the colony is mostly dormant. Even stranger, a fleet of Duskbringer ships have surrounded the colony as well. What could be happening here?

You land on the only landing pad that seems to be unguarded in the entire colony. As you make the uncomfortable waddle through the depressurized hallways in your burdensome space suits, you notice several very well armed and suited Duskbringer patrols back and forth, and the occasional Phantom lingering about only to duck into an alley or building when any soldiers go past.

Making sure not to be spotted, you duck between alley ways and follow the patrols. Eventually you find the commander's office, which clearly once belonged to a proud Phantom instead. "Renegades, in my colony? Hm, more likely than I thought. Didn't think anyone else was stupid enough to come to this forsaken place full of gasbags. Do you know how many times I've been called a 'breather' here? What kind of insult even is that? Sure, we have to wear these big ugly suits just so we can breathe, but at least our biology isn't comprised of hot air!"
The Duskbringer smirks and leans back in her chair. "But I'm getting carried away. I assume you're peaceful, since you aren't shooting yet. So, if you're up for it... I have an offer. We took this colony a few weeks back in hopes of securing part of the Dynasty's Aether supply. It's gone wonderfully, except these damn Phantoms started teaming up. Now, the Dynasty's sending Vagabond hitmen to screw with us, hoping we'll leave before long. I sure as hell ain't losing to a species as inferior as this. Hmph. The Dynasty had its prime some eons ago, but now it's time for a new glorious empire. One run by Zoltans, but to make that happen first we need the kind of weapons this Aether will go towards making. Intel suggests a hidden fleet is waiting for a good chance to strike. Take out their leader and I'll compensate you."

You aren't sure how it'd reflect on the Federation to be assisting the Duskbringers like this, but the Dynasty is no ally of the Federation either. If the 'compensation' will help you in your mission, then so be it.

You duck into one of the alleyways and try checking the insides of several buildings. Eventually you find what seems to be a hideout constructed inside an abandoned warehouse. "Who comes to this zone of control? Be you Duskbringer? Or perhaps a fellow countryman or Vagabond? State thine name and business in these parts!" You let the Phantom know you're a Renegade, seeing no reason to lie. "Hark, a Renegade? I should be disgusted to share space with such an undignified entity... but thou might be most useful to this good cause. The Zoltan menace has assumed control over this land, and seized the most important assets of Aether! Unless thou should wish for such equipment to fall into the hands of your enemy, it is my wisest suggestion thou chart a course to enact sweet justice. Thine choice is yours, but time is ever ticking."
If what the Phantoms say is true, and you have no reason to assume it isn't, then you can't let the Duskbringers seize a large supply of Aether! Get ready for battle!

choice.text: Report the Phantoms to the occupational forces.

event.text: Though assuming you're hostile at first, once you manage to speak to the Duskbringers they seem reasonably pleased, if not a bit cold towards you. "Good, so the Renegades wisened up and learned not to mess with the superior force. Smart one you are. The damn Dynasty started cooperating with the Vagabond clans just to spite us. Seems the only thing this dysfunctional species can agree on is they don't want anyone else to have their fair share of Aether. For your trouble and cleaner state of mind, I think we can work up some kind of reward."
For whatever reason there might be for Duskbringers to be in Dynasty space, you don't want to get involved in any way.

event.name: DYNASTY_OCCUPIED_GHOSTS
event.text: During the disarray caused by the fight, it seems a combined force of Dynasty and Vagabond vessels have broken through the Duskbringer defenses and sent them packing. Back in the colony, the surviving Ghosts are celebrating. "Thou inflict your blows most elegantly, Renegade. I can see now why the Federation would seek your employment. You may be confused, yes, as to why the likes of Spectral and Vagabond have joined here, but for all the struggles in our species, at least any sane and rational being can come to the mind that suicide bombing neofascists are not worthy of wielding the sacred technology of the Forefathers. Please, accept one of our finest soldiers. They will serve you masterfully."

event.name: DYNASTY_OCCUPIED_DUSK
event.text: With the leader of the Dynasty fleet taken out, the rest of the forces are scattered and disorganized, allowing the Duskbringers to pick them off easily. "Excellent work Renegade. Never though I'd be complimenting my enemy for their combat, but you've got skills. I can't lie, I'm impressed. If you ever decide you're tired of this Federation bullshit, and want to make the Multiverse a better place afterall, then give the Duskbringers a call, alright? We aren't stupid, we can cooperate with inferior beings when they're loyal. Now, your compensation."

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_DYNASTY_MONSTER
event.text: Your computer is suddenly flooded with alerts from nearby Dynasty security platforms. You listen to the static as your translator struggles to pick out something discernable from pure noise. "Avast! Turn thine's spirits away from this place and take content in safety not to be found here."

You assume they'll simply ignore you, but to your surprise a Phantom appears on the other end. "Oh? Have the maniacal hands of the lingering demon not yet snatched you away from this plane? Then consider yourself lucky, and take this chance to flee. You would be no coward to do such a thing..."
"A most horrible demon! It haunts these grounds, it ravages our colonies and it displaces our supplies! Oh flee, oh flee, for it shall strike you too if you stay!"

choice.text: We shall help! Fight the horrible demon.

event.text: You pilot further into the nebula, preparing yourself mentally for whatever monstrous ship lies ahead. At last, you lay eyes on it... and it's not really what you expected.
Sounds like there's something bad going on here - it's only safe to turn tail and run.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_DYNASTY_ENGINEER
event.text: You follow the signal of the distress call to what looks to be... an abandoned Engineer vessel? The crew are nowhere to be found, but there's signs of a struggle, and the air is thick with the putrid scent of Ghosts.

choice.text: Try and track down the Engineers.

event.text: Exploring the nearby system leads you to a Dynasty station with several ships docked. Inside, several Ghosts are jeering as one of the engineers is escorted towards a guillotine device with a shimmering electrified blade. They spot you and give you a pleading glance, silently begging you to help them.
You draw your blaster and shoot the guard escorting the engineer, followed by the execution machine itself. You run out of the room followed by the wounded engineer as angry Ghosts rush towards you!

choice.text: Stay safe and hang back to scrap their ship.

event.text: With no one to stop you, you pull apart the hull of the engineer vessel and bring it back aboard.

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_DYNASTY_GRANDFATHER
event.text: You barely have a moment to investigate the source of the distress call before it comes to you. A vagabond vessel approaches, carrying a Phantom alpha. "Hail to me! I am Aneidio, grandfather to Dessius! Though time has been most cruel, I look to you for respite from the constant heckling that I am plagued with."

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Check the thoughts of the Ghost.

event.text: "It issss obvioussss he isss not really the grandfather of thisss sssupposssed Dessssiusss. Neverthelessss, he ssseemss to TRULY believe it himssself. Hilariousssly sssad."

choice.text: Tell the Alpha you believe him.
Try to explain to him that he can't be.

event.text: "You question me? I am in outrage!" The Ghost suddenly attacks!

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Check the thoughts of the Ghost.

event.text: "It is obvious he is not really the grandfathhher of thhhis supposed Dessius. Neverthhheless, he seems to TRULY believe it hhhimself. Hhhilariously sad."

choice.text: Tell the Alpha you believe him.
Try to explain to him that he can't be.

event.text: "You question me? I am in outrage!" The Ghost suddenly attacks!

choice.text: If you're his grandfather, then how are you not still in charge?

event.text: "You question me? I am in outrage!" The Ghost suddenly attacks!
"Hahahah! Then I bet you are not even that of the real Dessius! Do not lie to me!" The ship suddenly attacks!

event.name: DYNASTY_GRANDFATHER_BELIEVE
event.text: "Hah! I hardly believe it. If you are telling the truth, then I demand you solve for me one problem which ails me. My most critical skeptic, a Reaper captain named Tykaneous, resides nearby in this system. See to it he perishes, and I will join your crew. You should be honored to even be presented such a chance."
"You're working with the old prune? That ass-wad has never ceased to annoy me. Didn't know the Federation employs ass-wad sympathizers, breather!"
"Hmph. Then out of my sight, breather!"

textList.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: It's strange how aggressive the Dynasty is, especially when the break away Vagabond Ghosts are much more reclusive. Though, perhaps that may be why they broke away in the first place. But, you'll have to think about this later, as a Dynasty vessel is inbound!
Make no mistake, the ship coming at you isn't friendly. A Dynasty vessel lurches forward, eyeing your weapons before attacking!
A garbled message comes across your radio. "Weapons. They belong to me. GIVE!" A Dynasty ship uncloaks nearby, weapons drawn!
For such an elegant name as the Spectral Dynasty, their ships are uncharacteristically hostile and violent. There's no better example than the vessel here, as it approaches menacingly.
A shot flies right past your ship, and seconds later a purple vessel comes drifting out of the clouds. Looks like it's Ghosts... and they don't look friendly!

A bloodchilling scream fills your speakers, followed by unsettling static. Any captain with lesser nerves might have fainted on the spot, but you know better. This isn't some demon, this is a much more real threat. A Dynasty vessel approaches!

Looks like you're receiving a short range broadcast. "Your flesh shall appease the demon's heart one more day. Your weapons shall be its destruction! For the good of the Dynasty!" A Ghost vessel appears nearby, weapons drawn and already firing!

An unsettling chant echoes through the nebula as a ship approaches. "The demon's heart shall cease! The demon's heart shall cease!", followed by the flashing of gunfire as a Dynasty vessel draws near. Are you the demon? You aren't sure, but you won't have time to ask!

In light of the seemingly empty nebula, you make conversation with the crew on enemies you could have found here instead. As soon as one of them mentions the Dynasty, a ship comes barreling out of the nebula, as if it were summoned. Speak of the devil...

At first you assume the static over the radio to be nonsense, but suddenly your translator starts to pick up words! "A breather! In Dynasty space, how putrid. It turns my insides into coils of anger. I will unleash hell on you scum!"

textList.name: NEBULA_VAGABOND_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: The Vagabonds usually just avoid Dynasty space, not worth the risk. This ship must be desperate - desperate enough to attack you!
Looks like you aren't safe from the scrap hungry Vagabonds, even in Dynasty space where they try to so hard to repel them. Prepare for combat.
You notice a Vagabond ship nearby watching you hungrily. "In my heart I feel the desire of a new vessel... this one is depreciated and has failed its function..." The Ghosts attack!

A Vagabond, likely fleeing from Dynasty patrols, has stumbled right into you. "You side with the Dynasty, nay? Oh, for what am I asking. The risk is not worth it, I shall simply remove you from my path."

textList.name: NEBULA_REBEL_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: Usually the Rebel ships you'd expect to see here are Autos, but it's not surprising to see an Engineer here either. Unfortunately, they're no less friendly either!
"You've just come here to make my damn job harder, haven't you? Piss off!" A particularly agitated Engineer vessel swerves to attack you!
After a long day working on the always damaged Auto-ships they construct, it's no wonder the Engineers feel the need to let off some steam. Alas, it looks like you're their next target!
"Oh come on! I haven't even finished my lunch break! You picked the wrong time to ruin my day, asshole!" Hostiles inbound!
Could it be? A Rebel ship? Your eyes aren't lying to you - and this is no ordinary Rebel. It's an Engineer, but they're no less deadly!

textList.name: NEBULA_AUTO_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: The Dynasty has been waging 'war' against the Auto-ships for a long time now. How the Rebels are able to afford such a massive stream of ships - or why Vance approved it - is a mystery to you, but it's only a hopefully minor inconvenience to you.
"You are not father. Father is not as ugly as you. Entering combat mode." The nearby Rebel Auto-ship suddenly activates and attacks!

You assume this to be an empty beacon... until you notice the dozens of dormant Auto-ships floating through the nebulas. You try to avoid them, but unfortunately it looks like one of them has noticed you and attacks!
You practically bump hulls with a Rebel Auto-ship, but it's too late to slip away before it's already noticed you and started to attack!
Curse the Rebels and their massive fleet of Auto-ships at constant disposal. Looks like you have another ship to take care of before you can carry on.
The Dynasty will probably be pleased to hear of your path of destruction through all of the Auto-ships you see. But before you can brag, you have another ship to add to your kill count.

textList.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_HOSTAGE
textList.text: "OooooOoOh, so you've come to interfere? A royally immense pain in the end the Federation is proving to be!" An agitated Dynasty vessel attacks as soon as you enter. Behind them is an unidentified ship they must have been interrogating before this!

The Dynasty normally doesn't take prisoners, but it seems they haven't gotten the desired reaction from the unidentified ship behind them, as you can hear the agitation in the shouting Ghost captain's voice. As soon as you enter the system however, his concentration focuses on you!
Looks like two ships are here - one of unidentified origin, and the other Dynasty. The Dynasty ship doesn't seem to want you around, because they attack almost immediately!

event.text: Looks like the victim was just some civilians. "Thanks for the help. Is nowhere safe anymore? I chose to come here over a trip through the Hive, but it might have been safer the other way around. My ship is ruined. I think I'll come with you."
Looks like the ship was little more than a damaged Auto. Beyond the point of repair, it's best just to scrap it.

It appears the Dynasty ship's victim was a Rebel vessel! They put on a tough appearance, but it's clear to you that they're thankful. It's not hard convincing them to lie to the fleet about your location.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_DYNASTY_ELITE
event.text: The Reapers are the Dynasty's finest vessels. You've heard the Phantoms are hard to please, which says a lot for these hand picked elites to be put in charge of the Dynasty's highest matters. Apparently, you classify as one such thing!

textList.name: TEXT_DYNASTY_OUTPOST
textList.text: The Dynasty seems to appreciate keeping a very close watch over potential threats... so close in fact, that they've set up a forward station all the way out here. Maybe it contains data worth something to you?
You've seen few factions as overly paranoid as the Dynasty. A full blown outpost has been established here, and scans show it has data. Valuable data.

For what reason is this beacon marked as important? As soon as you jump in, it's clear. A Dynasty outpost has been established here, and the beacon marker was a warning for ships to stay away. Somehow they haven't spotted you, yet...

Looks like a broadcast in many different languages is being sent out from a nearby Dynasty outpost. It's right to the point: "This observation location is not to be tampered with. Attempts to raid or damage Dynasty property will be met with lethal force."
At first you assume your eyes are deceiving you, but nay. This is a Dynasty outpost, quite bravely posted so far out from Dynasty space.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is a location of a Dynasty forward outpost.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: If the Dynasty is watching this sector, chances are they've already collected a ton of data... and data in any form is valuable to you!
Newton knows for what reason the Dynasty has been establishing these locations around the galaxy, but getting involved is a less than good idea.

choice.text: (Dessius) Request access to the data held in the outpost.

event.text: If the Dynasty is watching this sector, chances are they've already collected a ton of data. Luckily, you do happen to have a powerful ally at your side, who can grant you access to said data. Smooth talk aside, you are granted supplies and an advantage against the Rebel fleet.

event.name: DYNASTY_OUTPOST_DEFEAT
event.text: The outpost has fallen. This definitely won't please the Dynasty, but what are they going to do about it?

Looks like one of the station's terminals survived, a black box of sorts. In it contains heavily detailed map data for this sector, and predictions of the Rebel fleet progress. This will help greatly!

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_SPECIALRUIN
event.text: You've heard that the Dynasty's territory is littered with ruins from days past. But the wrecks in the distance... well, those don't look like Dynasty ships to you.

A massive Dynasty ship lurches towards you. "Wastes of days past are not those which require the temperament of modern day's impacts. What shift in the cosmic balance has led to your sudden appearance to this location? Do thou seek to stir a ruckus? Or just make the days of mine less enjoyable for the foreseeable future? Should I even continue to persist in this reality after?"

The Phantom sighs. "Your barbaric vernacular singes my tongue, but yes, I shall put an attempt to communicate in a way your primitive ape brain might understand. This beacon is the last of the great Obelisk wastes in this sector that require cleansing. This task was left up to Salvaging Operation DN-03. All objects or artifacts collected here are to be brought back for processing. We request that you leave, and warn you that our vessels are armed for combat as well as they are prepared for collection of ancient rubbish."

choice.text: Fight them to access the ruins!

event.text: "Ooh, you are a foul creature! How the anger and thoughts of violence twist your face into an unpleasant swirl of unconditional hatred. Erasing you shall do all but yourself a favor."

The Phantom lets out the loudest scream you've ever heard. "EEEK! DO MY EYES DECEIVE ME? THE OBELISK HAVE RETURNED?! Oh by the Reaper's name shall I fight to make certain your disease of a species may never return in forces of such volume ever again!"

event.name: DYNASTY_SPECIALRUIN_REWARD
event.text: "Ruination! It comes! Oh how the foul blackness consumes my sight. I weaken, and I fade. Exit, stage right..." The Dynasty vessel has fallen, and you scrap the wreck.
With the Dynasty out of the way, you pull apart the ancient wreckage, and find a unique weapon unlike any you've seen!

You catch Dessius giving you a disapproving look, but you figure he'll get over it eventually. If he really cared, he would have stepped in beforehand. You pull apart the ancient wreckage, and find a unique weapon unlike any you've seen!

event.name: DYNASTY_SPECIALRUIN_LOG
event.text: As you start to leave, you notice a strange, still illuminated augment installed in the ship's cargo bay. Scans reveal the device can tap into Multiverse Drives from across other realities!

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_DREADNAUGHT
event.text: This beacon provides quite the break from the bland purple clouds elsewhere in this sector. In the distance is also what looks to be the Dynasty Capitol, and the Prime Reaper's palace. You're surprised the Ghosts have so little protection for this important structure...

As you approach, it suddenly becomes apparent something is deathly awry. Blaring sirens fill the air as distant blots of color scurry about on the surface. Distant laser fire can be heard as the shadow of a massive black object moves closer to the distant palace, trailed by the ruins of what was once the Dynasty's finest fleet.

Looks like it's an Auto-ship... and far larger than usual. As soon as you enter its scanning range, it speaks. "It is advisable you leave. I do not aim to kill you. Not today. My batteries are better spent testing out my chassis on some easy targets. Leave, and I will kill you another day instead. That is my promise." Oddly well spoken for a robot...

choice.text: Let's teach this hunk of metal some manners.

event.text: "Unadvisable decision. Your failure will be my pleasure. You are aware the odds are massively against you? Regardless... you will die here."

choice.text: Abide this peculiar warning and leave.

event.text: "A wise decision. If only my superiors could listen to me in such a manner."

choice.text: This is as good a time as any to leave.

event.text: This isn't a good place for a Federation ship to be. You owe nothing to the Dynasty - you aren't going to waste valuable time saving them from whatever latest monstrosity the Rebellion has cooked up.

event.name: DYNASTY_DREADNAUGHT_VICTORY
event.text: You land on the planet's surface, briefly considering salvaging some of the Dynasty wrecks before a massive Dynasty cruiser flies by and lands next to yours. Out of it steps several Alphas and a pink Ghost wearing armor and wielding a massive sword. If you had to take a guess, this would be the Prime Reaper, the ancestral leader of the Dynasty.

The Reaper begins to speak, but you can't understand a word he says. You realize you left your translator back on the ship, but before you can run and get it the Reaper waves you back and presses a button on his armor. "The demon's heart is perished! Who art thou, and for what reasonings have you come to bless us with this?"

"Mysterious! Intriguing. Most intriguing. Are you always this cryptic? I hope so! I am Dessius, son of Adotious, 16th Prime Reaper of the Spectral Dynasty. You have saved our people, no name. I am inclined to like you because of that. Long after the terror of the Obelisks have we feared another invasion might bring our climactic end, and today the demon almost got his wish. Until you arrived, that is!"

"The Obelisks. One of 5 ancient empires that ruled the galaxy so long ago your kind have no memories of their rule. I cannot blame your ignorance, those foul cuboids were but their own cause of destruction. A god complex does no good, especially not if you wield tech capable of ripping holes through space time. But enough of them. They're dead, much unlike us today! At last, we see the end of the foul demons. Their kind shall plague us no more!"

choice.text: The Rebel AI is kept on the Flagship, not that Dreadnaught.

event.text: "You are to say... that was not the demon's heart? Then we shall continue to teeter on the brink of imminent doom unless this monster can be brought to ultimate peace! But, my not-present ears detect the faintest slivers of hope in your breath. You say, you know the location of the heart? The true source of our sufferings? Then I must go in attendance. In our wake shall remain not one demon's twitching coniver that we have not sent to the gallows!"

event.name: DYNASTY_DREADNAUGHT_REWARD
event.text: "Oh, but before we depart, I find it imperative that we prepare for the travels ahead. It is clear to me now the Federation is no longer a threat. I shall deliver but my finest war vessels to their lands so that they too may vanquish the Rebel threat that terrorizes us all! As for you my friend, let us see what not we can help you with."
